content: backside bottom or butt of a chain stitch this is the part of the chain stitch that is opposite of the two loops the ones that form the v that you would normally insert your hook under in other words if you turn the chain upside down so that you are looking at the bottom of it you will see a line of dashes it is under each dash that you would insert your hook if you were instructed to crochet into the back bump of each chain stitch magic_ring the star pattern starts out with a magic_ring if you are not familiar with this technique i highly recommend typing magic_ring crochet into your preferred search engine to learn how to do it however if you prefer not to use the magic_ring method you can chain 2 stitches and then work into the second chain from the hook as directed for example if the pattern reads make a magic_ring single_crochet 5 times into ring… you could instead chain 2 single_crochet 5 times into the second chain from the hook directions directions are the same
